meanings.sent1: The price of the car was negotiable, so we were able to talk about it.
meanings.sent2: In a negotiation, terms are negotiable to reach a mutual agreement.
meanings.sent3: The negotiable terms of the contract made it easy for both parties to come to an agreement.
meanings.sent4: Her flexible schedule was as negotiable as a piece of clay, ready to be molded.
meanings.sent5: The negotiable nature of the deadline allowed for adjustments to be made easily.

meanings.definition: Able to be bargained or traded
meanings.sent1: The antique vase was negotiable, and the shop owner was willing to haggle over the price.
meanings.sent2: Items at the flea market are often negotiable, giving buyers a chance to barter.
meanings.sent3: The negotiable cost of the painting made it tempting for art collectors to make a deal.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was as negotiable as a rare coin, valuable but open to exchange.
meanings.sent5: The negotiable value of the old book allowed for a fair trade to take place.

meanings.definition: Capable of being settled through negotiation
meanings.sent1: The dispute was negotiable, and the mediator helped both parties find a resolution.
meanings.sent2: Legal matters can be negotiable if both sides are willing to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The negotiable outcome of the meeting surprised everyone with its fairness.
meanings.sent4: The future of the project was as negotiable as a peace treaty, requiring compromise from all.
meanings.sent5: The negotiable solution to the conflict brought peace to the community.
